column5: I m thinking all customers are Prosecco alcoholics! ;)

I was expecting my very first order tomorrow. Having tried to update my order today I was told that I couldn t do this as I had bottles of Prosecco in my basket. I now have received an email this evening telling me that due to demand that the Prosecco deal has been removed but I could have an e- voucher  instead ?????? Really Sainsburys? Order with you cancelled and will not bother shopping with you again.
What is the cost of the loss of goodwill? Suspect you have lost a lot of customers over this. Your silence is deafening.
Might be helpful if you changed the price you re offering your Taste the Difference Prosecco at on your website. People might be forgiven for thinking it s on offer.

How is Sainsburys offering proccecco online and in store on special offer but then email me saying  We wanted to let you know that unfortunately due to unprecedented demand the Taste The Difference Prosecco you ordered is no longer available on the promotion price of £7.50. This means you will be charged the full price of £10 minus any discount that might apply  for example buy 6 bottles of wine and save 25%.  So that you don t lose out we would still like to honour the offer  we have therefore added the price difference as an e-voucher to your account which you can use next time you shop online.  Even though it is still on offer till 07/06/2016. How is this right? If it is no longer on offer to me then why are they still advertising it? And customer service are so rude and have confirmed they have it in stock but won t give it to me at the offer price because it s been so popular!!!

Hi I would just like to say a massive thank you to your lovely ladies this morning in basingstoke petrol station. I accidently put in the wrong fuel in my ca and your staff were fantastic. They even me a cup of coffee. Please let them know how briilant they all were. They all were so supportive. Thank you ladies.
Not happy that my special offer order is not being honoured!  Please dont expect repeat business from me  !!

Very disgusted to get an email telling me due to popular demand of taste the difference prosecco  they are charging me the full price and not the offer price  I m a new customer and I will never show with sainsburys again after this

Not cool that you ve changed prosecco pricing early because you ve been caught out by MSE. T&Cs say that online prices are  guide prices only . Does this mean that you can offer products at any price you like on the website and charge whatever you like when you compete the order? Is this ethical?
Refreshing attitude today by one of your delivery drivers when I was out cycling - waited patiently behind me till I got to a wider stretch of road where he could pass safely.  EX36 area. Thank you!

Is there any way of getting goods that are generally available delivered (dinner service)?? It s showing as available but not for delivery to five areas of the country I tried where I have relatives. I tried emailing the online service and got a very unhelpful reply. Thank you!

I like Sainsbury s. Generally. But really sometimes happens something totally weird. This is the current situation in the Farnborough (Hampshire) unit since a couple of days: Highland spring water  50p for a bottle of 1.5l. Great price! Reduced from 60p. So you get the pack of 6 and you pay... 3.20£. Now this is in contrast with the laws of the market (if you buy a bunch of the same item the price of the singe unit diminishes). Obviously it is also in contrast with the math: 6 time 0.50p = 3.00£. So... if you buy more  you spend... more then what you expect.  Isn t it weird?

I ordered this last week and had it been delivered last week I would have got the deal. Due to work commitments I couldn t have it delivered until tomorrow - an hour ago I received this. Disgusting 😡  We wanted to let you know that unfortunately due to unprecedented demand the Taste The Difference Prosecco you ordered is no longer available on the promotion price of £7.50. This means you will be charged the full price of £10 minus any discount that might apply  for example buy 6 bottles of wine and save 25%.  So that you don t lose out we would still like to honour the offer  we have therefore added the price difference as an e-voucher to your account which you can use next time you shop online.  You ll find full terms and conditions for all of our offers on our website  click here http://help.sainsburys.co.uk/help/website/terms-conditions-online-payment  Thanks for shopping with Sainsbury s  Kind regards  Customer Service Team

Cancelled my firest order before it was even delivered.  Won t be using them again.  Customer service have a couldn t care less attitude when speaking to them.  Onwards and upwards. Plenty of other outlets out there to go to.

I m also one of the many who have had the email tonight retracting the offer price for the Prosecco which has prompted me to cancel my order. So sainsburys  by changing an extra £2.50 per bottle  how much have you lost tonight in cancelled orders?? Shocking customer service and I will not be ordering again!!

So not happy with sainsburys castle bridge road nottingham tonight  stood at the Deli counter with my daughter for at least 10 to be completely ignore by the 2 members of staff who by the way we re doing nothing  no other customers waiting just plain RUDE.....

I am furious!!! Shocking customer service from Sainsburys tonight  leaving me with only 2 hours to cancel my order before I am charged £10 per bottle that is STILL ON OFFER at £7.50!!! The email I get says they re sorry but they re not going to honour my order placed last week due to  unprecedented demand  yet continue to advertise the offer online!?? You ve given me an e voucher but I don t intend to use it as will not be doing another shop with you  I m FUMING!!

I am really shocked and disappointed that after ordering wine on line and paying for it  on your special promotion at buy 6 bottles and get 25% you are now charging me the full price. I do not want an evoucher I want the discount that was applied when I purchased the order. I have shopped with Tescos  for years and never ever have I had this issue with them. How can you sell something to a person offer a special promotion only to retract it a day later after payment ???

Very disappointed with Sainsburys that the order i placed with the price promotions on the prosecco was not honoured and have just received an email telling me due to high demand they cant honour the promotion price and will be charging me full price.  Order cancelled now!

This means you will be charged the full price of £10 minus any discount that might apply  for example buy 6 bottles of wine and save 25%. What s the point of having a store phone number if nobody answers the phone??!!

I recently had a very disappointing online shopping experience with your Bognor Regis branch - I missed my delivery slot (it was due between 16.30 - 17.30 and he arrived at 16.36  whereas I was stuck in traffic coming from London and didn t get to the house until 17.00). I take full responsibility for that but given that the order was for a very large shop  the person I spoke to in the customer service department wasn t at all interested in trying to help me out or find any kind of solution. That then left me with 13 people arriving for a weekend for a special family celebration and no food so I had to rush out myself to go and buy enough for that evening. It was arranged that the shop would then come on Saturday morning first thing but it was only the alcohol and the cupboard produce that arrived - there was no fresh produce. The alcohol also had all their security tags on them which meant we were unable to open any of them. Again  no help from your customer service team who told me they couldn t deliver it until 2pm - so yet again  I had to rush out to the supermarket to go and buy enough for breakfast for everyone. I tried to get hold of your online manager there on a number of occasions and it wasn t until my third message that she called me back. I was expecting to hear back from her with some sort of solution or compensation for all the extra food I had to buy but have heard nothing from her. I shop with you every week and have always had a very good experience but this really is completely unacceptable and so disappointing. During such a competitive time when I would have thought that supermarkets would be trying to keep their loyal and regular customers  this is definitely not what I would have expected.

Heya there Sainsburys! Wondered if you could advise me on which of your stores stock  Whiptop Parve  squirty cream? I bought some once and I loved it. I live in Oswestry  but am willing to travel.... I go down to Dorset once a month too so any down south  esp Poole area  would be useful.
love your new free from range  my son is sitting pigging out on chocolate cake to celebrate!

I hope Sainsburys has alerted every customer to the problem experienced by anyone who has taken up the offer of a  free  box of 40 Tetley tea bags. On checking my receipt I found that a voucher to cover the difference was 30p short of the amount .....now 30p to one person is neither here nor there but I wonder how many people haven t checked or didn t bother to complain? That s a lot of 30p s to the company. I ve just had an email back seemingly quite flippant that IT problems just happen but they will make sure it doesn t happen again - well that s what they said to me last time when they offered a  free  coke zero and I had the same issue. But hey  at least I got my 30p back  very big of them.....
Hey  please help me out My daughter has 3 red and white summer dresses and they keep running when I wash them. I follow the instructions and still running. As she is 4 they are washed regularly!!!!

So disappointed with Sainsbury online  place my first order and want to add some more items  which was ok but could not check out  called helpline who told me that I needed to spend more money to get the deal. So I did. But I still could not check out  called back again and a very unhelpful guy told me its was because something was out of stock. So He cancelled my order and my new account. Lets hope Sainsbury understand that if they do offers for NEW customers they need to be more helpful.

Last week I ordered some clothes online. Had text and email to say they d arrived in store. Shortly before I went to collect them you sent me 13 texts to say they d just left your warehouse. I collected said clothes last Thursday so imagine my surprise when I m sitting here now just receiving another 13 texts one after the other to say they re just leaving your warehouse again! Please sort your IT out :-)
Sainsbury s is a Great Company and the best Supermarket  but do you have any plans to introduce Contactless Technology at the Checkouts thank you?

So i asked our local Sainsburys to get some more gluten free products as i have recently had to go wheat free for health reasons  I go in today and they have such a bigger range available! Top marks to you guys!! Sainsbury s You are awesome! :D xx
Why have you stopped people commenting on the post about your sexist kids clothing? I am a regular customer of yours  I get an online shop every week. I said nothing offensive   only fact.

This is a complaint regarding my Fridge Freezer we purchased with Argos in October 2014. We had only had it a couple of weeks and it start making funny noises which we later learnt it was the compressor not working correctly  few months later it completely broke down and we were with out a Fridge freezer for 6 weeks Argos refused to replace it  sent a engineer from Indesit He showed my Husband how to deal with the noise problem which is a joke as my husband is not a well man. It has broke again and have now wait 4 weeks for an engineer one due out on the 7th never turned up on the 24th no phone call ! Argos will not replace with out an independent assessment  which is madness as we have to pay for it we paid £500 on the 31st of October 2014 a new fridge freezer should last at least 5 years not just 8 months as its now 18months later we sit here withno food in a fridge due to the fact we can only buy on a daily basis as to put in fridge it all goes off .Cheese ham and cook beef from saturday had to be throw away this morning. All we want is a replacement so we can shop and cook meals We will never shop from Argos again..

I would like to say a Fantastic Well Done to all the brilliant ladies and gents beavering away at Dunstable  Bedfordshire store  trying their best to fight the severely leaking roof over aisle 1 and 2  whilst keeping all customers safe and happy. Dunstable Store is absolutely brilliant and deserve a Gold Star. I hope the rain stops soon so it helps with the clear up.

I live alone and Sainsburys sent me two vouchers for £9 off when I spend £60. My daughter (5 in her household) received 4 vouchers with £4.50 off on a £30 shop!! £60 is a lot for me to spend in one go. Why not send everyone the 4 vouchers? I would love an answer please Sainsburys.

Thank you  thank you  thank you Sainsburys for your fantastic new additions to your Free From range. As a mum of 2 children who are gluten free  we were all far too excited to see your new products  especially the celebration cakes! Thank you for providing more choice for Coeliacs. 😃😃😃

My local sainsburys is Nottingham Road   Nottingham

Such a disappointing  new online customer  experience with Sainsbury s!  Having purchased items for a charity cream tea  I then had to send the whole order back because of almost complete substitution.  :(

I want to your Sunderland North store today for the first time Nd I can promise you that I will never return!  The customer service was terrible  I was called a liar and your  supervisor  who dealt with us looked so scruffy I was unsure if he actually did work there!  I shop in Durham sainsburys a lot with my family and never have I ever been treated or spoke to the way I was today either there or in any other shop!!  I will certainly think twice about shopping in any sainsburys store after that experience!

WHY does your Kelso store have such LOUD mindless adverts? What is the point? This type of noise is stressful and can be downright upsetting to some.

Unlike the one Waitrose is currently offering  it is one I can carry with integrity. I AM nuts about recycling. But I am also nuts about veganism  for the animals  the planet and my own health. Waitrose has a bag design which is offensive to vegans. I can t possibly use it as it is - but I have scrawled all over it to make it possible for me to not be disgusted to carry it about with me. Yours  on the other hand  is great.  I hope you will continue to print designs on your bags that your vegan and vegetarian customers will be happy to take out with them.
Just bought a tub of quark today bb22/6 and it s just white water Yak
I was very happy to find your new free from range at Apsley Sainsbury s - the chocolate cake is delicious! 🙂

Why does Sainsburys continue to stock John West Tuna ??? Back in 2011 John West made a commitment to clean up their fishing practices by 2016 - today  only 2% of their tuna meets that criteria. John West continues to use unsustainable fishing devices threatening endangered sharks  turtles and other marine life. If the major UK supermarkets refuse to stock this dirty tuna  John West’s business will be under threat  and they’ll have no choice but clean up their practices. Come on Sainsburys  you have the power!
Can you please tell me if you have now stopped selling sainsburys free from sliced white bread. It is no longer on the shelf and there is no ticket for it in my local branch  Lyons farm  Worthing??

Feeling quite let down by Sainsbury s cafe  no vegan options on the menu and when I asked if I could have two pieces of toast I was declined the option. Can you please look into your cafe menu and make some adjustments?  Thanks in advance.
Thank you thank you !!!! For 3 safe cakes which my nut allergic and wheat avoiding daughter can have. It makes a world of difference  and so happy this morning.

Sainsbury - well done on supplying not only nut but gluten free celebration  cakes . As a parent of a child with peanut and nut allergy   and also avoiding gluten we are thrilled . I also note your now stocking Cocoa Libre chocolate which is delicious and is nut   dairy   wheat and gluten free. Please keep up the good work by adding more nut free products into your Free From range as it s always very disappointing to find barely anything nut free .

I would like to make a complaint about the customer service I received in your Salisbury store on Friday evening. I am nearly 5 months pregnant and was absolutely desperate for a wee. The public toilets out in the carpark were closed  so I entered the store (where I was about to do my weekly shop) and saw 3 female staff members chatting near the tills. I went and explained my situation and was told I couldn t use a toilet! Then they told me the nearest one is about 5 minutes walk away  to which I explained I wasn t able to hold it any longer. I left the store in tears and had to return to my car. My husband drove me to waitrose  where I was able to use a toilet  we then did our shop there instead. I am absolutely disgusted that your staff were unable to help me  a pregnant woman in a desperate situation!

Please excuse this   wall of text   but I d just like to offer some constructive feedback on your delivery service in the Wyre Forest area. After about a year at £1  my usual Thursday delivery slot shot up to £3 overnight. I grumbled  but I m paying it because the drivers continue to arrive within my chosen hour  unfailingly cheerful  polite and helpful  and it s still a reasonable price.   I wish I could say the same for the people who pack the boxes for delivery. Standards are definitely on the decline. Last Thursday I discovered that my milk containers had been placed on their sides in the bottom of a box  and then so much had been thrown  on top  that one of the bottles had leaked milk all over the bottom of the box. Had I not needed the contents of that box I would have sent the whole thing back  but as it was  the driver kindly refunded me the items that had to have packaging completely removed  and also for the rather dented  leaky bottle of milk.   The driver was brilliant; he got some paper towel to help me dry all the items in the box so I could take them to my kitchen. They all had to be washed before I could put them away to avoid the stink of dried milk.  After the driver had gone  I found more items whose packaging had to be disposed of as it had become saturated with milk. I was too fed up to bother chasing refunds etc. and that s really not what I m after anyway. These packing errors make the drivers  jobs more difficult than they already are  and that s just not fair on them.  This isn t the first time I ve had to be refunded for damaged goods  or for rotten fruit/veg. The standard used to be great  but since more people are opting for online services  the standards in the warehouses seems to be slipping somewhat. The delivery drivers - in my area at least - remain some of the best ambassadors for Sainsbury s and you should be proud of them. I wish I could say the same for the pickers/packers; it s as if they simply don t care.

Lord Sainsbury paying large donations to the Stay in EU.  I will not  as a result  be purchasing any items from Sainsburys  in future.

I have never had beef of such poor quality from Sainsbury before what a waste of money !

Hi ...I was just wondering when your new Free from range will be available in the Horsham store .. Have seen some pics and its looks fab !!

It is with a heavy heart that I write this post. I purchase all of my shopping from Sainsbury s  at Chafford Hundred  Thurrock  with deliveries taking place twice most weeks. Most of the delivery crew are lovely  polite  kind and always baring a smile. However  in the past few weeks  I have had one called Julia  who is nothing more than a thug. She approaches my door like a hitman  deliberately pulling up her sleeves to display the huge tattoos on her generous biceps. She talks to the customer like she s a 13-year-old chav who s sole purpose is to make the residents of the street they re on suffer. You know the ones  the ones who proudly boast about their ASBOS like it s a university doctorate? Well  anyway  that’s the only way to describe the behaviour of this Julia Pritchard character. I digress. Back to my complaint  I am a woman of almost 40 years  with a daughter that approaches 20 in a few short weeks. Unfortunately  due health complications  I can’t always be the person to greet the driver and receive my groceries  but my daughter never fails to open the door with the manners that have been instilled in her since birth. Julio came a couple of weeks back and got irate with my daughter because in her own words ‘she looks under 25’. Well  I should hope so  seeing as she’s net met her second decade yet. My daughter pointed out that she never get’s Id’d by any of the other drivers  and seeing as there is never alcohol or other restricted items and that the house was clearly undergoing major constructions  asked was it really necessary. Julio argued her point  and my daughter gracefully relented. There were a couple of substitutions on the list so my daughter called out to me to ask if they were suitable. Upon hearing my voice  Julio  took great offence and told me to “get up and sign for my own shopping!” Now  after paying for a service  and having my adult daughter present to sign for the groceries  do you think that was appropriate? For all she knew  I could’ve been laid up with a full body cast! Anyway  my daughter expressed her displeasure at her blatant disrespect for her mother to which the delivery girl responded with shouting and swearing  and a whole lot of stepping up into my daughters space in order to look down upon her. I  of course telephoned head office to complain  and was assured that they didn’t want to lose a customer and that I wouldn’t have to lay eyes upon her again… Having caught you up to speed  this brings us to this morning. A rapturous knocking on my front door sent my little dog into a frenzy  so I instructed my daughter to remove him so that the delivery person wouldn’t be exposed to any threat. Once it was in hand  I opened the door with the same smile I use to greet everyone. The first thing that struck me was the offensive stance of this woman. And the second was that she seemed unprepared to see me standing there. After recovering from her shock  she groused  in a most unpleasant manner  “Oh  are you signing for the shopping this week?” Odd  no? I responded  nonetheless. “Yes.” She regarded me for a moment before hitting me with the most ridiculous request. “I need ID…” I laughed  and asked  “Are you serious?” “Yeah!” was her gruff response. Of course  this only served to aggravate me  as anyone and their blind grandma can see that I’m over 25 –four decades  remember?– Anyhow  I told her that I certainly will not be producing identification  that I’m almost 40 years old  and that the ID she saw only recently was that of my adult daughter. She made a flip remark under her breath  to which I reminded her  this happened a couple of weeks ago with her. She responded with a wolfish grin  “You don’t want your shopping  then?” I do not negotiate with those who try to terrorise me. So I asked her why she was here  I was assured by head office that I wouldn’t have to deal with her unpleasantness again. My weekly grocery bill alone is probably more than she gets paid. Anyway  with that  she threw my paperwork at me  told me to “Shop at Asda ” and walked away with my groceries still on her van. Now  I wish to point out that I have been using Sainsbury’s online shopping for in excess of a year now  and have only ever had two complaints. Both times it has been with her. I don’t know her or anything about her  so why would I have any problem with her? I ask you  would you put up with being treated this way in your own home? I have been up to the store AND have called the online delivery helpline to complain about this matter. I am posting this because I want something done about this menacing woman. If she’s treating me like this  then I’m sure she’s the same way with other innocent service users. My biggest fear is that she may be doing this to the more vulnerable members of society  the elderly  for example  especially those who are too afraid to speak out for fear of reprisal.  Please feel free to share this post  especially if you’ve found yourself the victim of a power mad delivery boy. You do not have to tolerate bullying  regardless of what these bullies say. Empower the weak. Empower yourself.

Dear Sainsbury s  I ve been a Sainsbury s shopper for a long  long time now and frankly  I far prefer the supermarket to certain others  that will remain nameless but that rhyme with  fresco  and  Mazda . However  I feel rather as though the Sainsbury s empire has let the thousands upon thousands of coeliacs in the UK down this week.   From 9th - 15th May this year  it is Coeliac Awareness Week. It is an incurable autoimmune condition that affects an estimated 1 in 100 people in the UK. For one week every year  the major supermarkets typically reduce the cost of gluten free items (which  as you know  are already up to five times the price of their non-gluten free counterparts)  giving coeliacs and others who avoid gluten  a chance to stock up on items for a slightly lower price.   However  I notice that this year  while Tesco offers 3-for-2 on their entire free from range  Asda has  rolled back  the price of gluten free times and Morrisons has created a range of offers across their gluten free items  Sainsbury s has declined to participate. It feels a little like a slap in the face for your coeliac customers  who have enthusiastically purchased from your generally wide range of gluten free items. Instead of feeling looked after and having our custom appreciated  we are left feeling that our custom is better appreciated by competing supermarkets.   This evening  I will be going to my local Tesco  where I will be stocking up on various gluten free items. Items I would have preferred to buy from my preferred supermarket. I can only hope that you will make the effort next year.   Disappointedly    Vikki Cook
